SEARCH
Package com.example.taskmanager

Class Task

java.lang.Object
com.example.taskmanager.Task
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Task extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a task.

A task includes attributes such as title, description, category, priority, due date, status, and associated notifications.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Task

      public Task(int id, String title, String description, com.example.taskmanager.Category category, com.example.taskmanager.Priority priority, LocalDate dueDate)
      Constructs a new task with the mandatory attributes.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the task
      title - the title of the task
      description - the description of the task
      category - the category of the task
      priority - the priority of the task
      dueDate - the due date of the task

    • Task

      public Task(int id, String title, String description, com.example.taskmanager.Category category, com.example.taskmanager.Priority priority, LocalDate dueDate, String status)
      Constructs a new task with the mandatory attributes and a specific status.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the task
      title - the title of the task
      description - the description of the task
      category - the category of the task
      priority - the priority of the task
      dueDate - the due date of the task
      status - the status of the task (must be a valid status constant)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the status is not valid

    • setNotification

      public void setNotification(com.example.taskmanager.Notification notification)
      Adds a notification to the task.
      Parameters:
      notification - the notification to add
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the task is completed
      IllegalArgumentException - if the notification reminder time is after the due date or is before today

    • deleteNotification

      public void deleteNotification(int id)
      Deletes a notification by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the notification to delete
